text:
Get your HBO accounts ready (or alert the friends and family members whose logins you use to watch “Game of Thrones”) -- soon, you’ll be able to watch all eight “Harry Potter” movies.

?RELATED: A month-long film fest is making sure we get our Harry Potter fix — and butterbeer



Previously, HBO only had the rights to stream “Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire” as well as “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.” But now, the entire franchise will be available on all HBO platforms starting Jan. 1, which means, yes, you can stream them anytime you want on HBO Go and HBO Now.

?RELATED: A Harry Potter version of ‘Pokemon Go’ is coming to your smartphone



HBO is kicking off its Harry Potter marathon (good riddance to Freeform’s Harry Potter weekends) at 9 a.m. on Monday, Jan. 1 and ending in the early morning of Jan. 2. Then it starts all over again the night of Jan. 2, with one film airing each night at 8 p.m.
